title: 4-month-old girl hit by gun pellet, in stable condition at hospital
content:
MUSKEGON COUNTY, MI -- A 4-month-old girl is at the hospital after being struck by a gun pellet at Lakewood Club area home.
Police and rescuers were called to the 300 block of E. Calumet just prior to 7 p.m. Thursday, Oct 13 on a report of an injured child.
A Muskegon County sheriff's lieutenant said the child appeared to have been struck by a gunshot pellet or BB and was bleeding from the arm.
He said the circumstances of the shooting were not immediately known. Deputies were at the scene investigating as of 9 p.m.
He said the shooting appears to be accidental.
The lieutenant said the child's bleeding was controlled and she was in stable condition at an area hospital.
